data.name: Sum of Slices of a List
data.description:
# Task
Create a function that accepts two arguments: a list `lst` and a number `n`. The function should return a list containing the sum of each of its contiguous slices. Slices in the list are comprised of consecutive values that, when summed, do not exceed a maximum of `n`. 

It's important that no slice's cumulative sum surpasses the value of `n`. However, if an individual integer within the list is equal to or greater than `n`, it should also be included in the result.

# Examples
```python
sum_of_slices([10, 29, 13, 14, 15, 16, 17, 31, 20, 10, 29, 13, 14, 15, 16, 17, 31, 20, 100], 100)
➞ [97, 78, 87, 68, 100]

# First slice: [10, 29, 13, 14, 15, 16]
# 10 + 29 + 13 + 14 + 15 + 16 = 97
# The next value could not be included in this slice because
# the total would exceed 100.

# Second slice: [17, 31, 20, 10]
# 17 + 31 + 20 + 10 = 78
# The next value could not be included in this slice because
# the total would exceed 100.

# And so on ...

sum_of_slices([58, 3, 38, 9, 140], 140) ➞ [108, 140]
# First slice: [58, 3, 38, 9]
# 58 + 3 + 38 + 9 = 108

# Second slice: [140]

sum_of_slices([13], 10) ➞ [13]

sum_of_slices([15], 1) ➞ [15]
```
# Notes
- Do not sort the list.
- n > 0 and min(lst) > 0
